intro: Pterisanthes hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and are followed by small, berry-like fruits. Pterisanthes hirtiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
